alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Covington; Jasper; Jefferson Davis; Jones; Simpson; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 12:29PM CDT until August 24 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Simpson County in central Mississippi... Southern Smith County in central Mississippi... Southern Clarke County in east central Mississippi... Southern Jasper County in east central Mississippi... Jefferson Davis County in south central Mississippi... Covington County in southeastern Mississippi... Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 1229 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Laurel, Ellisville, Magee, Collins, Mendenhall, Stringer, Pinola, Union, Taylorsville, Prentiss, Mount Olive, Sandersville, Heidelberg, Hebron, Center Ridge, Sanford, Lone Star, Moss, Moselle and Clem. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Clarke; Covington; Jasper; Jefferson Davis; Jones; Simpson; Smith
